Topics per level : 

Macro : Political, Economical, Sociological, Technological, Ecological, Legal
Meso : Costs, Revenues, Competitors, Suppliers, Customers, Partners
Micro : People, Culture, Processes, Dreams & Projects, Fears

content:
Please provide a step-by-step flow of how to demo a customer implementation in Odoo. 

Go through the following phases : 
- Initial system configuration (modules/apps to be installed, basic settings).
- One flow, from A-Z, corresponding to the customers current described flow. Go from one app to the other, explain what we do in each app to complete the flow. 
- Explore additional apps that can benefit the customer in his industry, sector or business based on the apps available within Odoo. 

Make sure to include any key considerations. If something is unclear, request more details from me. 

DESCRIPTION OF THE CUSTOMER PROJECT INCLUDING SECTOR, CURRENT FLOW(S), AND OTHER SPECIFICS :
title: NBLM : Flow Request

content:
Assist in resolving a presales ticket for Odoo by providing a detailed response to the following aspects:

Customer Requirements: Outline key considerations for assessing the customer's industry and business needs, including specific modules they might benefit from.
Solution Proposal: Suggest the most suitable Odoo apps or customizations based on the customer‚Äôs workflow, including integrations with third-party software if necessary.
Demonstration Preparation: Detail how to prepare an effective demo that highlights Odoo‚Äôs core features relevant to the customer, including key selling points.
Technical Clarifications: Address potential technical questions about deployment options (cloud vs. on-premise).
Ensure that the response is customer-centric and emphasizes the flexibility and scalability of Odoo to handle their business challenges.
title: NBLM : Presales Ticket

content: Brainstorm with me on how we can help a business by implementing Odoo for them. Think opportunities, apps, and game changers.
title: NBLM : Implementation brainstorm

content:
Please generate a documentation/user guide for the [Industry/Sector Name] sector described below, for Odoo applications. Follow the structure below:

Title & Introduction:

Title: ‚ÄúOdoo for [Industry/Sector Name]‚Äù
Introduction: A brief paragraph on how Odoo empowers businesses in this industry through efficiency and integrated solutions.

Structure : Table of Contents:
1. Basics 
Flow 1: [Name/Module] [Emoji]
Flow 2: [Name/Module] [Emoji]
‚Ä¶ (Include all flows as provided)
2. Tips for Success
3. Do You Want to Go Further?

Detailed Sections instructions:

---

Basics : 
- bullet point list of each mentioned app in the flow/app list hereunder, with what they do, in 15 words or less. 

For each flow/app:
- Heading (e.g., ‚ÄúOpportunities üéØ‚Äù for CRM)
- Two description variations (e.g., for CRM, see options below) + more detailed explanations in bullet point format about how the app can be used:
Option 1: ‚ÄúThe CRM module helps you capture and track customer inquiries, manage communications through chatter, and schedule follow-up tasks.‚Äù
Option 2: ‚ÄúOur CRM allows you to monitor leads, organize activities, and streamline communication with potential customers.‚Äù

Provide similar generic descriptions for each subsequent app.

Tips for Success:

- Offer a few generic tips to help users maximize the benefits of the industry module.

Do You Want to Go Further?:

- End with an invitation for further exploration, additional apps, or a call-to-action for more information.

--- 

Extra guidelines on formatting / wording: 
- do not mention "flows" in the output. this is a term we use ourselves
- when i talk about a flow in this prompt, it's a sequence of actions, it should be clear from your output (e.g. : crm leads to quotations leads to sales leads to projects leads to invoicing), and multiple flows can exist in a business
- do offer some amount of detail under every flow section, structured with a short paragraph, then bullet points + bold text for the apps, or important parts. 


DETAILS ON THE INDUSTRY, APPS AND FLOWS THAT NEED TO BE INCLUDED IN THE USER GUIDE :

--- 

- Industry/Sector Name:
- Business Flows (in order):
- Do you want to go further apps:
title: Industry Knowledge Article

content:
I'm working on demo data for a CRM. 

Here is a CRM data import file. I need you to add multiple new rows for a given use case (below). Don't change the column names. 

Detail on the columns : 
- id = uuid
- contact_name = name of the contact to which the opportunity is associated
- email_from = contact's email
- expected_revenue = expected revenue of the opportunity
- name = name of the opportunity, should always be something that's descriptive, e.g. "microsoft office cleaning", or other stuff that can describe the opportunity, in less than 8 words
- tag_ids = tags that are linked to the opportunity, invent new ones, multiple tags per opportunity would be great, separated by a ","
- website : optional, depends on the opportunity. 

Adjust it for the following type of business :
title: CRM Demo Data

content:
I'm working on demo data for company products.
 
Here is a product import file. I need you to add multiple new rows for a given use case (below). Don't change the column names. 

Detail on the columns : 
- id = uuid
- name = product name, short, ten words max. 
- type = product type, choice between "goods" and "service"
- list_price = sales price
- categ_id = product category, choose a few ones for this business if it makes sense, don't make 10 different ones for 10 different products, e.g. a grocery shop may have "drinks" and "food", etc. 
- product_tag_ids = product tags, make up a few ones that make sense, you can add multiple tags per product, separated by ","
- description = notes on the product, a few sentences typically.
- standard_price = product cost, fill in if relevant, not always the case
 - default_code = internal product reference, usually a short code. 
- description_sale = description on quotations & sales orders

I want you to output an xlsx file. 

Adjust it for the following type of business :
title: Product Demo Data

Example : 

Tattoo Shop: 
- Commercial flow : appointment/walk in -> discuss idea -> arrange quote -> fix dates -> execute tattoo'ing -> invoicing -> send aftercare instructions
- Communication flow : social media posting, website, etc. 

And so on : go through all the possible flows, consider b2b, b2c when applicable, contracts, and all other aspects of how the business operates.
